title: Everyday English Course 37
description: Improve your English comprehension skills through short everyday conversations and situational dialogues.

sections.title: Section 1: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

variables.a: Where are the two speakers?
What are they?

answerOptions: He had to do something else.
instances.correctAnswer: He had to do something else.

variables.a: Why didn't John come to the party?

answerOptions: She is not sure if she can join them.
She will skip the class to see the film.
She will ask the professor for leave.
instances.correctAnswer: She is not sure if she can join them.

variables.a: What can we learn about the woman?
What did the woman like doing when she was young?
What has caused the accident?

answerOptions: He fell down and hurt his leg.
instances.correctAnswer: He fell down and hurt his leg.

variables.a: What happened to the boy?
What will the woman probably do on Saturday evening?

answerOptions: He has bought a sweater in that shop.
She can't buy a suitable sweater in that shop.
instances.correctAnswer: She can't buy a suitable sweater in that shop.

variables.a: What does the man mean?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Where are we going to have the physical education class?
M: In the gymnasium.
W: May I stay in the classroom? I've got a really bad stomach ache.
M: No. You should observe the class in the gym.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
W: Where are we going to have the physical education class?
M: In the gymnasium.
W: May I stay in the classroom? I've got a really bad stomach ache.
M: No. You should observe the class in the gym.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
W: Where are we going to have the physical education class?
M: In the gymnasium.
W: May I stay in the classroom? I've got a really bad stomach ache.
M: No. You should observe the class in the gym.
{a}

variables.a: Where will the woman be?

sections.title: Section 2: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Good morning, sir. Could I ask you to register, please?
M: Certainly. What do I do?
W: Just fill in this form, if you would, please.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
W: Good morning, sir. Could I ask you to register, please?
M: Certainly. What do I do?
W: Just fill in this form, if you would, please.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
W: Good morning, sir. Could I ask you to register, please?
M: Certainly. What do I do?
W: Just fill in this form, if you would, please.
{a}

variables.a: What is the most probable relationship of the two people?
What can be learned about taxes from the conversation?
How does the man feel about what the woman said?

answerOptions: She'd like to have the windows open.
She likes to have the air conditioner on.
instances.correctAnswer: She'd like to have the windows open.

variables.a: What can be inferred from the woman's answer?
How much will the room cost for one month including electricity?

answerOptions: The man is under pressure from his wife.
The man usually follows his wife's advice.

variables.a: What do we learn from the conversation?

answerOptions: Say good-bye to her uncle at the airport.
Meet her uncle at the airport.
Fly to another city together with her uncle.
instances.correctAnswer: Say good-bye to her uncle at the airport.

variables.a: What will the woman do this evening?
Where was Lucy born?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Would you like another piece of chicken?
M: Yes, please. It's delicious. Did you cook it in Qianmen. How about some sandwiches?
W: Oh, no. It's Kentucky Fried Chicken. I bought it in Qianmen. How about some sandwiches?
M: Well, just one, please. Hmm, it's nice! You bought them in Kentucky Restau-rant al- so, didn't you?
W: Yes, I did. Let me give you some more chicken. There's plenty more.
M: No, thanks. I'm full I'd like a cup of tea, please.
W: Ok. Here you are.
M: Thank you. What a delicious supper!
{a}

{a}

variables.a: What can be seen at their supper table?

answerOptions: She doesn't agree with the man.
She doesn't know what to do.
instances.correctAnswer: She doesn't agree with the man.

variables.a: What is the woman's attitude?

sections.title: Section 3: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

variables.a: What's the woman's job?

answerOptions: He is too busy to go with her.
He has already visited the museum.
He has to read a history book.
instances.correctAnswer: He is too busy to go with her.

variables.a: What does the man mean?
What does the woman think of the restaurant prices here?
What is the woman's profession?
How many jobs have the man had?

answerOptions: The woman won't lend her bike.

variables.a: What can we learn?

answerOptions: She will prepare for her maths test.
She will prepare for her English test.
She will prepare for her history test.
instances.correctAnswer: She will prepare for her history test.

variables.a: What will the woman do later this evening?
How old will Jenny be tomorrow?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: What kind of shoes are those?
M: They're bowling shoes.
W: I've never seen such crazy colored footwear before!
M: They are for sliding on the floor before you throw the ball down the lane.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
W: What kind of shoes are those?
M: They're bowling shoes.
W: I've never seen such crazy colored footwear before!
M: They are for sliding on the floor before you throw the ball down the lane.
{a}

W: What kind of shoes are those?
M: They're bowling shoes.
W: I've never seen such crazy colored footwear before!

{a}

answerOptions: They keep you from falling down.

variables.a: What does the man say about the shoes?
How many people were caught in the fire?
